Generation V.Black: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
Generation V.White: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
Generation V.Black 2: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.
Generation V.White 2: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

Generation VI.X: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
Generation VI.Y: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren't washed off quickly, they'll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
Generation VIII.Shield: Amoonguss generally doesn't move as much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss’s caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
Generation IX.Violet: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.

Generation V.Black: Route 10 (both in dark grass and as fake items) Route 11
Generation V.White: Route 10 (both in dark grass and as fake items) Route 11

Generation V.White 2: Routes 11 , 22 , and 23 (both in tall grass and as fake items * ) Route 22 , Abundant Shrine * , and Pinwheel Forest * ( Hidden Grotto )
